intro: Oldenlandia barbata, commonly known as the hairy spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its small, white or pale blue flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas. Oldenlandia barbata is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with similar botanical features.
